{include "default_salutation"} –

"I had to drink water, urinate and make ablution for my prayers in the same sink. It was a humiliating experience because I could tell the last occupant probably used the sink as a urinal as well. They refused to give me cleaning supplies, a free hand soap, even toilet paper!"

"They did not issue me any mattress, pillow, blankets, sheets, etc. For 3 days, I was in a cold filthy freezing cell. I had to sleep on the cold metal bunk and felt like I might catch cold. I couldn't sleep at night or in daytime."

The Virginia Department of Corrections (VDOC) falsely claimed that over the last 18 months, it had ended its use of "restrictive housing," a euphemism the VDOC routinely uses for solitary confinement. Unfortunately, the words above from people inside Virginia's prisons within the past 18 months tell a different story. People are still being caged and tortured in solitary confinement, an inhumane practice that causes and exacerbates mental illness.

Regardless of what VDOC calls it, solitary confinement is torture. It is inhumane. And it must end.

End Solitary Confinement

And, the the Virginia Coalition on Solitary Confinement disputed this claim at a recent press conference. We also sent a joint letter to Gov. Northam earlier this week urging him to support legislation to end solitary confinement and investigate VDOC's claims of ending its use of "restrictive housing."

Please join our call for action and add your name to stop this barbaric, cruel, and dehumanizing practice.
